fields.name: Django Girls Berlin
fields.page_description: Django Girls is a one-day workshop about programming in Python and Django tailored for women.

fields.name: Django Girls Amsterdam
fields.page_description: Django Girls is a one-day workshop about programming in Python and Django tailored for women.

fields.name: about
fields.content:
Free programming workshop for women

Build your first website at EuroPython 2014 in Berlin!

Learn more »

fields.name: values
fields.content:
Django Girls

If you are a female and you want to learn how to make websites, we have good news for you! We are holding a one-day workshop for beginners!

It will take place on 21st of July in Berlin, on the first day of a big IT conference: EuroPython, which gathers a lot of talented programmers from all over the world.

We believe that IT industry will greatly benefit from bringing more women into technology. We want to give you an opportunity to learn how to program and become one of us - female programmers!

Workshops are free of charge and if you can’t afford coming to Berlin, but you are very motivated to learn and then share your knowledge with others, we have some funds to help you out with your travel costs and accommodation. Don’t wait too long - you can apply for a pass only until 30th of June!

Apply for a pass!

If you are a woman, you know English and have a laptop - you can apply for a pass! You don’t need to know any technical stuff - workshops are for people who are new to programming.

As a workshop attendee you will:

  • attend one-day Django workshops during which you will create your first website
  • get a free EuroPython ticket (which normally costs 400 €!), where you can meet people from the industry and learn more about programming
  • be fed by us - during workshops and EuroPython food is provided

We have space only for 40 people, so make sure to fill the form very carefully!

fields.name: apply
fields.content:
Applications are now open!

Application process closes on July 23rd and you\'ll be informedabout acceptance or rejection by July 28th (or sooner)!

Register

fields.name: faq
fields.content:
Do I need to know anything about websites or programming?

No! Workshops are for beginners. You don’t need to know anything about it. However, if you have a little bit of technical knowledge (i.e. you know what HTML or CSS are) you still can apply!

I am not living in Germany, can I attend?

Of course! Workshops will be in English, so if you have no troubles with speaking and understanding English - you should apply. If you need financial aid to get to Berlin or you need assistance with booking flights or hotel in Berlin - let us know. We are willing to help you!

Should I bring my own laptop?

Yes. We have no hardware, so we expect you to bring your computer with you. It is also important for us that you will take home everything you’ll write and create during workshops.

Do I need to have something installed on my laptop?

It would be helpful to have Django installed before workshops, but wouldn't expect you to install anything on your own.We will make sure that one of our coaches will help you out with this task.

Is EuroPython conference good for a total beginner?

As a workshop attendee you will get a free ticket to EuroPython - conference for Python programmers. Even though you are new to programming,conference is a good place to meet many interesting people in the industry and find inspiration.

Is food provided?

Yes. Thanks to EuroPython, snacks and lunch will be served during workshops.

fields.name: coach
fields.content:
Be a Mentor!

We would be delighted if you would like to join us as a mentor! Fill in the form here, but select the option to be a mentor.

We will contact you :)

Django Girls

Django Girls Australia is a part of bigger initiative: Django Girls. It is a non-profit organization and events are organized by volunteers in different places of the world.

To see the source for the program find us on Github: github.com/DjangoGirls.

If you want to bring Django Girls to your city, drop us a line: hello@djangogirls.org.

fields.name: partners
fields.content:
Sponsors

We couldn't be here without the support from amazing people and organizations who donated money, knowledge and time to help us make this a reality. If you want to contribute and support our goal, please get in touch: hello@djangogirls.org

fields.name: footer
fields.content:
Django Girls
Follow @djangogirls
Get in touch:
hello@djangogirls.org

♥ Django Girls Europe is organized by Ola Sitarska a nd Ola Sendecka with the support from EuroPython 2014.
Django Girls Europe is a part of Django Girls.
Every participant needs to follow the Code of Conduct.

fields.text_header: Apply for a spot at Django Girls [City]!
fields.confirmation_mail: Hi there!This is a confirmation of your application to Django Girls {CITY}. Yay! That's a huge step already, we're proud of you! Mind that this is not a confirmation of participation in the event, but a confirmation that we received your application. You'll receive an email from the team that organizes Django Girls {CITY} soon. You can always reach them by answering to this email or by writing to {your event mail}. For your reference, we're attaching your answers below. Hugs, cupcakes and high-fives! Django Girls
fields.text_description: Yay! We're so excited you want to be a part of our workshop. Please mind that filling out the form below does not give you a place on the workshop, but a chance to get one. The application process is open from {INSERT DATE} until {INSERT DATE}. If you're curious about the criteria we use to choose applicants, you can read about it on Django Girls blog. Good luck!

fields.title: Which operating system do you use?

fields.choices: I'm a total beginner, I don't know anything about it; I've tried some HTML or CSS before; I've tried some JavaScript before; I've done a few lessons of Python; I've built a website before; I work as a programmer
fields.title: What is your current level of experience with programming?
If you checked anything other than beginner, could you tell us a bit more about your programming knowledge?
What is your current occupation?
fields.help_text: What is your current job? Are you a student?

fields.title: Why do you want to attend the workshop?
fields.help_text: Tell us about your motivations and aspirations.

fields.title: How are you planning to share what you've learnt with others?
fields.help_text: Django Girls is a volunteer-run organisation and we look for people who are active and can help us help more women get into the field. We want you to share what you learn at the workshop with others in different ways: by organising a Django Girls event in your city, talking about Django Girls on your local meetups, writing a blog or simply teaching your friends.

fields.choices: Facebook; Twitter; From a friend; PyLadies
fields.title: How did you hear about Django Girls?
fields.help_text: Django Girls is a volunteer-run organisation and we look for people who are active and can help us help more women get into the field. We want you to share what you learn at the workshop with others in different ways: by organising a Django Girls event in your city, talking about Django Girls on your local meetups, writing a blog or simply teaching your friends.

fields.choices: I've read and understood the Django Girls Code of Conduct
fields.title: It is important that all attendees comply with the Django Girls Code of Conduct

fields.answer: I have done a simple course on coursera.
I've read and understood the Django Girls Code of Conduct
I am a stay at home mom.
I would love to create an event for other moms and create a startup for future moms.
I've tried some HTML or CSS before,  I've done a few lessons of Python
I would totally love to start programming!
